page.title: 17WANSFORD MAJOR ROAD TRAFFIC
page.content: The village of Wansford lies near the junction of two major trunk roads, the A1 and the A47. The A1 carries a very heavy flow of traffic along its north - south route between London and Scotland. A large proportion of the traffic passing Wansford consists of heavy goods vehicles. The A47 also carries considerable numbers of heavy goods vehicles since it is the major trunk route between the East Midlands and the ports of the east coast. At the intersection of the two roads a fly-over has been built to take the A47 over the A1, but despite this improvement to the road layout there are still many accidents at this busy intersection.
